questions.question: What does the `data-*` attribute allow you to do in HTML?
options: Store custom data private to the page or application.
Link external data sources to HTML elements.
Change the display of elements dynamically.
Specify the type of content in an element.
questions.answer: Store custom data private to the page or application.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define the header for a document or section?
How do you create an unordered list in HTML?
What is the purpose of the `<figure>` element in HTML5?
options: To encapsulate media content and its caption.
To define a section of a document.
questions.answer: To encapsulate media content and its caption.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a navigation section?
What does the `<mark>` element do in HTML?
options: Defines a section of content that is important.
Creates a link to another document.

questions.question: How do you specify that an iframe should take up the full width and height of its container?
options: By setting width and height to 100%.
By using CSS with position absolute.
questions.answer: By setting width and height to 100%.

questions.question: Which attribute is used to make an input field accept only email addresses?
What is the purpose of the `<template>` element in HTML?
options: To declare reusable HTML structures that are not rendered.
To create a script block for JavaScript.
To define a section for server-side templates.
questions.answer: To declare reusable HTML structures that are not rendered.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for the main content of a document?
